intro: Crotalaria abdal-kuriensis, commonly known as the Socotra crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to the Socotra archipelago. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and bean-like pods. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces a unique, spiny fruit that contains several seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
